Iâ€™m starting to become convinced I donâ€™t have bpd but more cptsd based on the fact that my bpd seemed to get worse when i tried doing dbt and responded better once I did started doing trauma based mindfulness and inner child work/started doing what my trauma therapist normally does for ptsd instead of treating me as a â€œtypical bpdâ€ pt.

1. iâ€™m sorry she said this to you. but just bc she said this to you doesnâ€™t necessarily mean she will leave you or that she doesnâ€™t care. people can say things and not mean them/say things carelessly/say things and have them be a projection etc. are you able to ask for more clarification? 

2. are you able to speak with a therapist/parent/trusted friend for support to help calm down? you need validation and support from someone asap. iâ€™m sure people on the internet help but it sounds like you could benefit from someone irl too. 

3. try to just take some deep breaths and focus on the present. i donâ€™t mean to sound like a trite assh*le but mindfulness has helped me a ton w my bpd. try to just not focus on anything and just breathe. play a game that can distract you, pet a fur baby, watch a show anything to take your mind away from this and just be somewhat present without doing anything harmful/rash. 

4. no matter what happens with this person know that your life and itâ€™s meaning are bigger than this relationship. the idea of being left and abandonment are terrifying and i know that that part of bpd is fcking awful but you on you own are strong even if you donâ€™t feel like it. 

5. i hope this helps. iâ€™m thinking of you and sending you well wishes wherever you are. donâ€™t shame yourself for feeling like you need a person or being afraid or panicking, itâ€™s natural and normal even outside of bpd. but just know that youâ€™re ok and strong on your own too.

In my opinion beauty is in the eye of the beholder. As you read through the comments you can see quite a variety of opinion here. 

A good thing to keep in mind is whatever else lives in the first house and how it can mesh together. For example I have a lot of â€œtraditionalâ€ â€œ good lookingâ€placements in my first house, but they run amuck with my jupiter asc being the closest as it can cause excess weight gain and I also have a uranus in the first so I am probably â€œgood lookingâ€ but strange as well. Just some things to consider. Itâ€™s all a blend and other placements should always be considered. 

However some â€œtraditionalâ€ good looks or striking features would be as follows 

1. Mercury asc wouldnâ€™t necessarily correlate with physical attractiveness but mental wit/good w words charismatic etc. 

2. Neptune asc is associated w physical attractiveness/mystique an ability to shift into whatever people want you to be. This is both good and bad as people can project ideals onto you. Lots of famous people have this placement. Think Marilyn Monroe. 

3. Anything ruled by Venus is going to be aesthetically pleasing typically so aspects/libra etc. 

4. A Lilith in first house will make a woman appear very physically attractive and dark, think goth hot or just more mysterious. Usually very steamy presence. 

In all reality we could go on about this for days, there are tons of aspects that rule physical vitality, mental dexterity, uniqueness, charisma, looks, its your pick. It all just depends on what OP and others would deem â€œattractiveâ€. There are so many extraordinary possibilities and combinations from astrology that lead way to different talents/looks etc that are shown in charts. 

To try to just limit it to one post is nearly impossible. If youâ€™re asking for ones self Iâ€™d recommend looking at your chart online and analyzing in depth there and doing as much research as possible. 

Or, if you are curious about others a fun game I like to play as the more I learn about astrology is guessing in my head what placements others may have as I meet them and pass them by/befriend them over time. Great way to think about things and eventually test your skills! 

Hopefully this helps and didnâ€™t entirely put anyone to sleep. Cheers!

I have struggled w terrible fear, anxiety, and panic all my life. Iâ€™ve always thought it was GAD or typical panic attacks. Pretty recently Iâ€™ve started to realize my anxiety stems from my childhood and the abuse Iâ€™ve suffered. Since this Iâ€™ve started to approach my anxiety attacks differently. Instead of using logic when having an anxiety attack or typical methods that are employed by other diseases Iâ€™ve started to talk to myself like Iâ€™m a child when Iâ€™m feeling distressed. 

Iâ€™ve started to do this bc nearly all my triggers are based out of fear or worries that weâ€™re created in childhood or based out of trauma. Iâ€™ve already noticed a significant difference in how it goes when employing this method. Without getting too in depth here-Iâ€™ve found that using inner child work has been dramatically helpful for me personally bc it is what has been the root cause of basically all my problems. 

My panic and fear has been hard wired into me bc of my abuser and my environment. Itâ€™s not something that can be treated for me using traditional methods which explains why they werenâ€™t working. Now when I have a panic attack I patiently dismantle the issue w my inner child and donâ€™t even try to look at it logically. I try to address myself like Iâ€™m having a temper tantrum and I just tell myself that Iâ€™m safe, Iâ€™m okay, my feelings are valid, and I remind myself of all the facts. My abuser is no longer here, etc. I distract myself with something simple and almost immediately my fear is gone. 

Before when Iâ€™d try to just move on and implement shame or other techniques using logic it didnâ€™t work. Bc thatâ€™s how my abuser would try to invalidate my feelings. Therefore it would just heighten my feelings of anxiety and cause me to spiral. Whereas using nurturing and mothering techniques gives me quite the opposite effect. 

Sorry for this novel. 

But yes. I HIGHLY recommend if you are READY (key word) working w your inner child. If you feel like you are in a safe enough place mentally to really reflect on what you need and missed out on do it. If you are NOT ready focus on other things you can change.

I had a really beautiful moment happen w my friend tonight. We were driving home in separate cars and I started to have a panic attack on the highway when I pulled off. She pulled off behind me and I called her and apologized. She was understanding and was like thatâ€™s okay! 

We got home and I explained that this particular exit was just triggering for me and I usually take a different way home, that I chose to take this one as it was faster bc she was behind me following me. She said â€œno worries! You just donâ€™t vibe w that exit!â€ And laughed and shrugged it off. Just like that. 

It hit me. Thereâ€™s nothing wrong w that. I have been shaming myself for opting to take that alternate route home for MONTHS. I explained that to my friend and she was so confused. â€œThey both get you home so who cares?â€ 

The fact that she was so accepting of me and it was so clear that it wasnâ€™t a big deal made me realize that my self judgment and hatred the past two weeks are really just that simple. Everything could be compared to this exit. If I just donâ€™t vibe with something itâ€™s okay and that my choice DOES matter. It sounds so silly but this was such a big deal.
